title: Used to Exercise 2
description: If it's possible, make a sentence with 'would + infinitive'. If it's not possible, use 'used to + infinitive':

parts.value: I / have short hair when I was a teenager

parts.answer: I used to have short hair when I was a teenager
answerList: I used to have short hair when I was a teenager

parts.value: We / go to the same little café for lunch every day when I was a student

parts.answer: We would go to the same little café for lunch every day when I was a student
answerList: We would go to the same little café for lunch every day when I was a student

parts.value: She / love playing badminton before she hurt her shoulder

parts.answer: She used to love playing badminton before she hurt her shoulder
answerList: She used to love playing badminton before she hurt her shoulder

parts.value: He / walk along the beach every evening before bed

parts.answer: He would walk along the beach every evening before bed
answerList: He would walk along the beach every evening before bed

parts.value: I / always lose when I played chess with my father

parts.answer: I would always lose when I played chess with my father
answerList: I would always lose when I played chess with my father

parts.value: She / be able to dance very well

parts.answer: She used to be able to dance very well
answerList: She used to be able to dance very well

parts.value: My grandfather / drink a cup of coffee after dinner every night

parts.answer: My grandfather would drink a cup of coffee after dinner every night
answerList: My grandfather would drink a cup of coffee after dinner every night

parts.answer: Luke didn't use to have a car
answerList: Luke didn't use to have a car

parts.answer: We used to live in Brazil
answerList: We used to live in Brazil

parts.value: My family / often go to the countryside for the weekend when I was young

parts.answer: My family would often go to the countryside for the weekend when I was young
answerList: My family would often go to the countryside for the weekend when I was young
